creditline: Lent by Donna and Cargill MacMillan Jr.
description: One of pair of goblets (see L2001.219.2) white glass goblet; stem consists of two swirls beginning at bottom of the bowl; foot consists of two rounded sides, both with protruding swirls (one horizontal, one vertical)
text: These extraordinarily early forms by Chihuly reached the present owners through the former wife of local artist George Morrison, who taught with Chihuly at the Rhode Island School of Design in the late 1960s. Chihuly had given them to the Morrisons as a wedding gift at that time. One can see how in his early years of glass experimentation, Chihuly took advantage of the natural qualities of glass to drip and pool, creating loose interpretations of functional objects.
title: Two goblets (Globs)
